intro: Epilobium changaicum, commonly known as the Changai willowherb, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem, while its flowers are borne in clusters at the tips of the branches. Epilobium changaicum is often found in meadows and forest edges, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitats.
